trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Search in Java | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Search in Java | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to build a custom Azure Search application using Java as your programming language.
trans-unit.target: How to build a custom Azure Search application using Java as your programming language.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Search in Java
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Search in Java

trans-unit.source: Learn how to build a custom Java search application that uses Azure Search for its search experience.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to build a custom Java search application that uses Azure Search for its search experience.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the [Azure Search Service REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798935.aspx) to construct the objects and operations used in this exercise.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the [Azure Search Service REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798935.aspx) to construct the objects and operations used in this exercise.

trans-unit.source: We used the following software to build and test this sample:
trans-unit.target: We used the following software to build and test this sample:

trans-unit.source: [Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers](https://eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-java-ee-developers/lunar).
trans-unit.target: [Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers](https://eclipse.org/downloads/packages/eclipse-ide-java-ee-developers/lunar).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to download the EE version.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to download the EE version.

trans-unit.source: One of the verification steps requires a feature that is found only in this edition.
trans-unit.target: One of the verification steps requires a feature that is found only in this edition.

trans-unit.source: JDK 8u40
trans-unit.target: JDK 8u40

trans-unit.source: Apache Tomcat 8.0
trans-unit.target: Apache Tomcat 8.0

trans-unit.source: To run this sample, you need an Azure Search service, which you can sign up for in the [Azure management portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: To run this sample, you need an Azure Search service, which you can sign up for in the [Azure management portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] Download the source code for this tutorial at [Azure Search Java demo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=530197) on Github.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] Download the source code for this tutorial at [Azure Search Java demo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=530197) on Github.

trans-unit.source: About the data
trans-unit.target: About the data

trans-unit.source: This sample application uses data from the [United States Geological Services (USGS)](http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm), filtered on the state of Rhode Island to reduce the dataset size.
trans-unit.target: This sample application uses data from the [United States Geological Services (USGS)](http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm), filtered on the state of Rhode Island to reduce the dataset size.

trans-unit.source: We'll use this data to build a search application that returns landmark buildings such as hospitals and schools, as well as geological features like streams, lakes, and summits.
trans-unit.target: We'll use this data to build a search application that returns landmark buildings such as hospitals and schools, as well as geological features like streams, lakes, and summits.

trans-unit.source: In this application, the **SearchServlet.java** program builds and loads the index using an [Indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798918.aspx) construct, retrieving the filtered USGS dataset from a public Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: In this application, the **SearchServlet.java** program builds and loads the index using an [Indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798918.aspx) construct, retrieving the filtered USGS dataset from a public Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Predefined credentials and connection information to the online data source are provided in the program code.
trans-unit.target: Predefined credentials and connection information to the online data source are provided in the program code.

trans-unit.source: In terms of data access, no further configuration is necessary.
trans-unit.target: In terms of data access, no further configuration is necessary.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] We applied a filter on this dataset to stay under the 10,000 document limit of the free pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] We applied a filter on this dataset to stay under the 10,000 document limit of the free pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: If you use the standard tier, this limit does not apply, and you can modify this code to use a bigger dataset.
trans-unit.target: If you use the standard tier, this limit does not apply, and you can modify this code to use a bigger dataset.

trans-unit.source: For details about capacity for each pricing tier, see [Limits and constraints](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798934.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details about capacity for each pricing tier, see [Limits and constraints](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798934.aspx).

trans-unit.source: About the program files
trans-unit.target: About the program files

trans-unit.source: The following list describes the files that are relevant to this sample.
trans-unit.target: The following list describes the files that are relevant to this sample.

trans-unit.source: Search.jsp: Provides the user interface
trans-unit.target: Search.jsp: Provides the user interface

trans-unit.source: SearchServlet.java: Provides methods (similar to a controller in MVC)
trans-unit.target: SearchServlet.java: Provides methods (similar to a controller in MVC)

trans-unit.source: SearchServiceClient.java: Handles HTTP requests
trans-unit.target: SearchServiceClient.java: Handles HTTP requests

trans-unit.source: SearchServiceHelper.java: A helper class that provides static methods
trans-unit.target: SearchServiceHelper.java: A helper class that provides static methods

trans-unit.source: Document.java: Provides the data model
trans-unit.target: Document.java: Provides the data model

trans-unit.source: config.properties: Sets the Search service URL and api-key
trans-unit.target: config.properties: Sets the Search service URL and api-key

trans-unit.source: Pom.xml: A Maven dependency
trans-unit.target: Pom.xml: A Maven dependency

trans-unit.source: Create the service
trans-unit.target: Create the service

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click **New** > **Data + storage** > **Search**.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click **New** > **Data + storage** > **Search**.

trans-unit.source: Configure the service name, pricing tier, resource group, subscription and location.
trans-unit.target: Configure the service name, pricing tier, resource group, subscription and location.

trans-unit.source: These settings are required and cannot be changed once the service is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: These settings are required and cannot be changed once the service is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: **Service name** must be unique, lower-case, under 15 characters, with no spaces.
trans-unit.target: **Service name** must be unique, lower-case, under 15 characters, with no spaces.

trans-unit.source: This name becomes part of the endpoint of your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: This name becomes part of the endpoint of your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: See [Naming Rules](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn857353.aspx) for more information about naming conventions.
trans-unit.target: See [Naming Rules](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn857353.aspx) for more information about naming conventions.

trans-unit.source: **Pricing Tier** determines capacity and billing.
trans-unit.target: **Pricing Tier** determines capacity and billing.

trans-unit.source: Both tiers provide the same features, but at different resource levels.
trans-unit.target: Both tiers provide the same features, but at different resource levels.

trans-unit.source: **Free** runs on clusters that are shared with other subscribers.
trans-unit.target: **Free** runs on clusters that are shared with other subscribers.

trans-unit.source: It offers enough capacity to try out tutorials and write proof-of-concept code, but is not intended for production applications.
trans-unit.target: It offers enough capacity to try out tutorials and write proof-of-concept code, but is not intended for production applications.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a free service typically only takes a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a free service typically only takes a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: **Standard** runs on dedicated resources and is highly scalable.
trans-unit.target: **Standard** runs on dedicated resources and is highly scalable.

trans-unit.source: Initially, a standard service is provisioned with one replica and one partition, but you can adjust capacity once the service is created.
trans-unit.target: Initially, a standard service is provisioned with one replica and one partition, but you can adjust capacity once the service is created.

trans-unit.source: Deploying a standard service takes longer, usually about fifteen minutes.
trans-unit.target: Deploying a standard service takes longer, usually about fifteen minutes.

trans-unit.source: **Resource Groups** are containers for services and resources used for a common purpose.
trans-unit.target: **Resource Groups** are containers for services and resources used for a common purpose.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you're building a custom search application based on Azure Search, Azure Websites, Azure BLOB storage, you can create a resource group that keeps these services together in the portal management pages.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you're building a custom search application based on Azure Search, Azure Websites, Azure BLOB storage, you can create a resource group that keeps these services together in the portal management pages.

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** allows you to choose among multiple subscriptions, if you have more than one subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** allows you to choose among multiple subscriptions, if you have more than one subscription.

trans-unit.source: **Location** is the data center region.
trans-unit.target: **Location** is the data center region.

trans-unit.source: Currently, all resources must run in the same data center.
trans-unit.target: Currently, all resources must run in the same data center.

trans-unit.source: Distributing resources across multiple data centers is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Distributing resources across multiple data centers is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create** to provision the service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create** to provision the service.

trans-unit.source: Watch for notifications in the Jumpbar.
trans-unit.target: Watch for notifications in the Jumpbar.

trans-unit.source: A notice appears when the service is ready to use.
trans-unit.target: A notice appears when the service is ready to use.

trans-unit.source: Find the service name and api-key of your Azure Search service
trans-unit.target: Find the service name and api-key of your Azure Search service

trans-unit.source: After the service is created, you can return to the portal to get the URL and `api-key`.
trans-unit.target: After the service is created, you can return to the portal to get the URL and `api-key`.

trans-unit.source: Connections to your Search service require that you have both the URL and an `api-key` to authenticate the call.
trans-unit.target: Connections to your Search service require that you have both the URL and an `api-key` to authenticate the call.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click **Home** and then click the Search service to open the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click **Home** and then click the Search service to open the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: On the service dashboard, you'll see tiles for essential information as well as the key icon for accessing the admin keys.
trans-unit.target: On the service dashboard, you'll see tiles for essential information as well as the key icon for accessing the admin keys.

trans-unit.source: Copy the service URL and an admin key.
trans-unit.target: Copy the service URL and an admin key.

trans-unit.source: You will need them later, when you add them to the **config.properties** file.
trans-unit.target: You will need them later, when you add them to the **config.properties** file.

trans-unit.source: Download the sample files
trans-unit.target: Download the sample files

trans-unit.source: Go to [AzureSearchJavaDemo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=530197) on Github.
trans-unit.target: Go to [AzureSearchJavaDemo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=530197) on Github.

trans-unit.source: Click **Download ZIP**, save the .zip file to disk, and then extract all the files it contains.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download ZIP**, save the .zip file to disk, and then extract all the files it contains.

trans-unit.source: Consider extracting the files into your Java workspace to make it easier to find the project later.
trans-unit.target: Consider extracting the files into your Java workspace to make it easier to find the project later.

trans-unit.source: The sample files are read-only.
trans-unit.target: The sample files are read-only.

trans-unit.source: Right-click folder properties and clear the read-only attribute.
trans-unit.target: Right-click folder properties and clear the read-only attribute.

trans-unit.source: All subsequent file modifications and run statements will be made against files in this folder.
trans-unit.target: All subsequent file modifications and run statements will be made against files in this folder.

trans-unit.source: Import project
trans-unit.target: Import project

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, choose **File** > **Import** > **General** > **Existing Projects into Workspace**.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, choose **File** > **Import** > **General** > **Existing Projects into Workspace**.

trans-unit.source: In **Select root directory**, browse to the folder containing sample files.
trans-unit.target: In **Select root directory**, browse to the folder containing sample files.

trans-unit.source: Select the folder that contains the .project folder.
trans-unit.target: Select the folder that contains the .project folder.

trans-unit.source: The project should appear in the **Projects** list as a selected item.
trans-unit.target: The project should appear in the **Projects** list as a selected item.

trans-unit.source: Click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Use **Project Explorer** to view and edit the files.
trans-unit.target: Use **Project Explorer** to view and edit the files.

trans-unit.source: If it's not already open, click **Window** > **Show View** > **Project Explorer** or use the shortcut to open it.
trans-unit.target: If it's not already open, click **Window** > **Show View** > **Project Explorer** or use the shortcut to open it.

trans-unit.source: Configure the service URL and api-key
trans-unit.target: Configure the service URL and api-key

trans-unit.source: In **Project Explorer**, double-click **config.properties** to edit the configuration settings containing the server name and api-key.
trans-unit.target: In **Project Explorer**, double-click **config.properties** to edit the configuration settings containing the server name and api-key.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the steps earlier in this article, where you found the service URL and api-key in the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), to get the values you will now enter into **config.properties**.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the steps earlier in this article, where you found the service URL and api-key in the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), to get the values you will now enter into **config.properties**.

trans-unit.source: In **config.properties**, replace "Api Key" with the api-key for your service.
trans-unit.target: In **config.properties**, replace "Api Key" with the api-key for your service.

trans-unit.source: Next, service name (the first component of the URL http://servicename.search.windows.net) replaces "service name" in the same file.
trans-unit.target: Next, service name (the first component of the URL http://servicename.search.windows.net) replaces "service name" in the same file.

trans-unit.source: Configure the project, build and runtime environments
trans-unit.target: Configure the project, build and runtime environments

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, in Project Explorer, right-click the project > **Properties** > **Project Facets**.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, in Project Explorer, right-click the project > **Properties** > **Project Facets**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Dynamic Web Module**, **Java**, and **JavaScript**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Dynamic Web Module**, **Java**, and **JavaScript**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Apply**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Apply**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Window** > **Preferences** > **Server** > **Runtime Environments** > **Add..**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Window** > **Preferences** > **Server** > **Runtime Environments** > **Add..**.

trans-unit.source: Expand Apache and select the version of the Apache Tomcat server you previously installed.
trans-unit.target: Expand Apache and select the version of the Apache Tomcat server you previously installed.

trans-unit.source: On our system, we installed version 8.
trans-unit.target: On our system, we installed version 8.

trans-unit.source: On the next page, specify the Tomcat installation directory.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, specify the Tomcat installation directory.

trans-unit.source: On a Windows computer, this will most likely be C:\Program Files\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat *version*.
trans-unit.target: On a Windows computer, this will most likely be C:\Program Files\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat *version*.

trans-unit.source: Click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Window** > **Preferences** > **Java** > **Installed JREs** > **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Window** > **Preferences** > **Java** > **Installed JREs** > **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In **Add JRE**, select **Standard VM**.
trans-unit.target: In **Add JRE**, select **Standard VM**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: In JRE Definition, in JRE home, click **Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In JRE Definition, in JRE home, click **Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Program Files** > **Java** and select the JDK you previously installed.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Program Files** > **Java** and select the JDK you previously installed.

trans-unit.source: It's important to select the JDK as the JRE.
trans-unit.target: It's important to select the JDK as the JRE.

trans-unit.source: In Installed JREs, choose the **JDK**.
trans-unit.target: In Installed JREs, choose the **JDK**.

trans-unit.source: Your settings should look similar to the following screenshot.
trans-unit.target: Your settings should look similar to the following screenshot.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, select **Window** > **Web Browser** > **Internet Explorer** to open the application in an external browser window.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, select **Window** > **Web Browser** > **Internet Explorer** to open the application in an external browser window.

trans-unit.source: Using an external browser gives you a better Web application experience.
trans-unit.target: Using an external browser gives you a better Web application experience.

trans-unit.source: You have now completed the configuration tasks.
trans-unit.target: You have now completed the configuration tasks.

trans-unit.source: Next, you'll build and run the project.
trans-unit.target: Next, you'll build and run the project.

trans-unit.source: Build the project
trans-unit.target: Build the project

trans-unit.source: In Project Explorer, right-click the project name and choose **Run As** > **Maven build...** to configure the project.
trans-unit.target: In Project Explorer, right-click the project name and choose **Run As** > **Maven build...** to configure the project.

trans-unit.source: In Edit Configuration, in Goals, type "clean install", and then click **Run**.
trans-unit.target: In Edit Configuration, in Goals, type "clean install", and then click **Run**.

trans-unit.source: Status messages are output to the console window.
trans-unit.target: Status messages are output to the console window.

trans-unit.source: You should see BUILD SUCCESS indicating the project built without errors.
trans-unit.target: You should see BUILD SUCCESS indicating the project built without errors.

trans-unit.source: Run the app
trans-unit.target: Run the app

trans-unit.source: In this last step, you will run the application in a local server runtime environment.
trans-unit.target: In this last step, you will run the application in a local server runtime environment.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet specified a server runtime environment in Eclipse, you'll need to do that first.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet specified a server runtime environment in Eclipse, you'll need to do that first.

trans-unit.source: In Project Explorer, expand **WebContent**.
trans-unit.target: In Project Explorer, expand **WebContent**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Search.jsp** > **Run As** > **Run on Server**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Search.jsp** > **Run As** > **Run on Server**.

trans-unit.source: Select the Apache Tomcat server, and then click **Run**.
trans-unit.target: Select the Apache Tomcat server, and then click **Run**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] If you used a non-default workspace to store your project, you'll need to modify **Run Configuration** to point to the project location to avoid a server start-up error.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] If you used a non-default workspace to store your project, you'll need to modify **Run Configuration** to point to the project location to avoid a server start-up error.

trans-unit.source: In Project Explorer, right-click **Search.jsp** > **Run As** > **Run Configurations**.
trans-unit.target: In Project Explorer, right-click **Search.jsp** > **Run As** > **Run Configurations**.

trans-unit.source: Select the Apache Tomcat server.
trans-unit.target: Select the Apache Tomcat server.

trans-unit.source: Click **Arguments**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Arguments**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Workspace** or **File System** to set the folder containing the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **Workspace** or **File System** to set the folder containing the project.

trans-unit.source: When you run the application, you should see a browser window, providing a search box for entering terms.
trans-unit.target: When you run the application, you should see a browser window, providing a search box for entering terms.

trans-unit.source: Wait about one minute before clicking **Search** to give the service time to create and load the index.
trans-unit.target: Wait about one minute before clicking **Search** to give the service time to create and load the index.

trans-unit.source: If you get an HTTP 404 error, you just need to wait a little bit longer before trying again.
trans-unit.target: If you get an HTTP 404 error, you just need to wait a little bit longer before trying again.

trans-unit.source: Search on USGS data
trans-unit.target: Search on USGS data

trans-unit.source: The USGS data set includes records that are relevant to the state of Rhode Island.
trans-unit.target: The USGS data set includes records that are relevant to the state of Rhode Island.

trans-unit.source: If you click **Search** on an empty search box, you will get the top 50 entries, which is the default.
trans-unit.target: If you click **Search** on an empty search box, you will get the top 50 entries, which is the default.

trans-unit.source: Entering a search term will give the search engine something to go on.
trans-unit.target: Entering a search term will give the search engine something to go on.

trans-unit.source: Try entering a regional name.
trans-unit.target: Try entering a regional name.

trans-unit.source: "Roger Williams" was the first governor of Rhode Island.
trans-unit.target: "Roger Williams" was the first governor of Rhode Island.

trans-unit.source: Numerous parks, buildings, and schools are named after him.
trans-unit.target: Numerous parks, buildings, and schools are named after him.

trans-unit.source: You could also try any of these terms:
trans-unit.target: You could also try any of these terms:

trans-unit.source: Pawtucket
trans-unit.target: Pawtucket

trans-unit.source: Pembroke
trans-unit.target: Pembroke

trans-unit.source: goose +cape
trans-unit.target: goose +cape

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: This is the first Azure Search tutorial based on Java and the USGS dataset.
trans-unit.target: This is the first Azure Search tutorial based on Java and the USGS dataset.

trans-unit.source: Over time, we'll extend this tutorial to demonstrate additional search features you might want to use in your custom solutions.
trans-unit.target: Over time, we'll extend this tutorial to demonstrate additional search features you might want to use in your custom solutions.

trans-unit.source: If you already have some background in Azure Search, you can use this sample as a springboard for further experimentation, perhaps augmenting the [search page](search-pagination.md), or implementing [faceted navigation](../search-faceted-navigation/).
trans-unit.target: If you already have some background in Azure Search, you can use this sample as a springboard for further experimentation, perhaps augmenting the [search page](search-pagination.md), or implementing [faceted navigation](../search-faceted-navigation/).

trans-unit.source: You can also improve upon the search results page by adding counts and batching documents so that users can page through the results.
trans-unit.target: You can also improve upon the search results page by adding counts and batching documents so that users can page through the results.

trans-unit.source: New to Azure Search?
trans-unit.target: New to Azure Search?

trans-unit.source: We recommend trying other tutorials to develop an understanding of what you can create.
trans-unit.target: We recommend trying other tutorials to develop an understanding of what you can create.

trans-unit.source: Visit our [documentation page](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/search/) to find more resources.
trans-unit.target: Visit our [documentation page](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/search/) to find more resources.

trans-unit.source: You can also view the links in our [Video and Tutorial list](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798933.aspx) to access more information.
trans-unit.target: You can also view the links in our [Video and Tutorial list](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798933.aspx) to access more information.
